skill.name: playwright-browser
skill.description: Control a Playwright browser via CLI - navigate, interact, and screenshot
skill.summary: Control a Playwright browser via CLI - navigate, interact, and screenshot
skill.author: Bind

security_audit.summary: Legitimate browser automation skill using Playwright. Medium risk due to browser control capabilities which inherently allow navigation to arbitrary URLs and interaction with web content. Static findings are mostly false positives from documentation examples being misidentified as executable code. The 'weak cryptographic algorithm' alerts are triggered by the word 'Playwright' in filenames - not actual crypto usage. The 'Ruby/shell backtick execution' alerts flag bash command examples in markdown documentation, not actual backtick usage.

content.value_statement: Need to navigate websites, fill forms, or capture screenshots programmatically. This skill provides CLI commands to control a Playwright browser session using the accessibility tree for reliable element targeting.
actual_capabilities: Start and manage persistent browser sessions with headed or headless mode
Navigate to any URL with automatic page load waiting
Retrieve page accessibility tree for element discovery and debugging
Type text into form fields and press keys like Enter and Tab
Click links, buttons, and other elements using role-based or CSS selectors
Capture full-page or viewport screenshots to output files
limitations: No JavaScript execution in page context beyond standard browser behavior
Cannot bypass authentication or access protected content without valid credentials
Single browser instance per session; no multi-tab coordination built-in

use_cases.title: Automate regression testing
use_cases.description: Navigate through web apps, fill forms, and verify UI elements programmatically

use_cases.title: Capture website screenshots
use_cases.description: Take full-page screenshots of websites for documentation or visual regression

use_cases.title: Debug web interactions
use_cases.description: Test form submissions, button clicks, and navigation flows in a real browser

prompt_templates.title: Start browser session
prompt_templates.prompt: Start a browser session with playwright-browser. Use headed mode so I can see the browser.

prompt_templates.title: Navigate and explore
prompt_templates.prompt: Navigate to example.com and show me the page structure using snapshot.

prompt_templates.title: Fill and submit forms
prompt_templates.prompt: Navigate to google.com, find the search box by role, type 'Playwright automation', and press Enter.

prompt_templates.title: Full workflow automation
prompt_templates.prompt: Start a session, navigate to github.com, take a screenshot of the homepage, then stop the session.

output_examples.input: Start a browser session, navigate to example.com, and take a screenshot
Navigate to duckduckgo.com, search for Claude Code, and click the first result
output: Page structure retrieved - found combobox 'Search with DuckDuckGo'
Typed 'Claude Code' into search box and pressed Enter
Search results loaded - found link 'Claude Code - Anthropic'

best_practices: Use element references like 'role:name' format for reliable targeting instead of CSS selectors when possible
Run in headless mode for CI/CD pipelines and headed mode for debugging visible browser behavior
Stop the browser session when done to clean up resources and avoid orphaned processes
anti_patterns: Avoid navigating to untrusted URLs that could execute malicious code or serve harmful content
Do not store sensitive credentials in plain text accessible to the browser automation or .playwright-data directory
Avoid running multiple concurrent sessions without proper process isolation and management

faq.question: What browsers are supported?
faq.answer: Playwright supports Chromium, Firefox, and WebKit browsers. The skill uses Chromium by default for maximum compatibility.

faq.question: What are the rate limits?
faq.answer: No built-in rate limits. Pace requests based on the target website policies to avoid being blocked or rate limited.

faq.question: Can this integrate with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes. Use headless mode for automated testing. The commands work in any environment with Node.js or Bun runtime.

faq.question: Is my browsing data safe?
faq.answer: Browser data is stored in .playwright-data directory. Review and clean this directory regularly for sensitive information.

faq.question: Why is my click failing?
faq.answer: Elements may have moved since the last snapshot. Run snapshot again to get the current page structure and correct element references.

faq.question: How is this different from Puppeteer?
faq.answer: Playwright offers multi-browser support and uses the accessibility tree for element targeting which is more reliable than CSS selectors alone.
